column4: Does anyone know how I get a cell phone working with Ubuntu? I want to be able to transfer files to it and that sort of thing. It's connected through usb, but isn't mounting. I'm not sure how to or if I can mount it manually.
afaik there is no software for that phone
you can write your own, it actually isn't that hard. very similar to talking to a modem
ok. is there some sort of how-to somewhere?
so what would I need to do then?
well, linux will treat it as a usb modem
you have to write an app that talks to it with appropriate AT commands
you know the first time I saw that TuxMobil page I thought it was for installing Linux on the cell phone. By the way, do you know what "dedicated Linux phone" means?
no, i don't know what it means
it works with my phone. i have the Motorola RAZR V3
kmobiletools seems to support a lot of phones though.
